dict.acceptation: 局促不安的；为难的；尴尬的；窘迫的；
（使）窘迫，（使）局促不安( embarrass的过去式和过去分词)；

sent.orig: "You're just embarrassed, that's all," and luckily I added: "Daisy's embarrassed too."
sent.trans: “你不过是难为情罢了，没别的。”幸好我又补了一句，“黛西也难为情。”

sent.orig: In China nowadays, curriculums in Secondary Vocational Schools (SVS) get into embarrassed situation.
sent.trans: 目前我国的中等职业教育课程陷入了一种十分尴尬的境地。

sent.orig: I was too embarrassed to say anything.
It was obvious that he was very embarrassed.
Mom embarrassed, always cannot cut come down to eat.
sent.trans: 妈妈为难了，总不能割下来吃吧。
